column5: Mepp's or panther martin? whats your favorite? For me I LOVE both, for big ol' brookies!
Panther Martins...
Mepps
Panther Martins, been working for me for over 30 plus years.
Both, but I take the treble off and run a single hook. Less damage to the fish
Hey, Hey , wait a minute.............you forgot to add the super vibrax to this thread!............Killers for Coho and Steelhead!
the mepps black fury #3.
For speckies tho, I prefer a smaller Hildebrant with a snell hook and worm, seem to get more that way when they're finicky!
Both have their time and place really.  What about the worden's rooster tail?
I'm with Eazy, another vote for the Blue Fox vibrax...#4 Fire Tiger, awesome for Bows and Ho's!!!!!

I haven't used a spinner in a long time, but I preferred a Mepps Aglia when I did use them. The wide blade of an Aglia compared to the willow leaf of a panther martin made for a much slower retrieve, which proved beneficial to me. I target bigger fish these days and find crank baits or jigs easier and more effective to use. Jigs especially. If you're targeting smaller Trout in a creek, give a Rapala Countdown size 3 a try. I've caught numerous Trout on a CD 3.
I like Mepps as I rarely use my Panther Martin. I must start this year.

i stick to mepps, have never used panther martins and vibrax only used once with good results. i stick more towards just a plain worm hook and sinker with a little spiner that you can attach a hook to, not sure what their called, their more of a spinner bait style spinner except smaller and plain chrome or whatever it is. they work great for me cause i usually only creek fish for specks and i get great catches that way! only  a few select people in town know about my pools!
Have to admit I've always been partial to the Black Fury.

For brookie fishing down this part of Southern Ontario, I use both but find myself flipping and casting the Mepps a bit more oftern.  With our fish being smaller than what you'd find up your way, I use the smaller size spinners and find the heavier weight of the Mepps makes 'em easier to throw.
1/32 oz. with black blade and feathers has always been a killer for me ! Love them Specks  Gil
Panther Martin: silver blade, yellow body, red spots.  Killer!
I'll take ol Lucky Strike!
That's the one.
Mepps all the way, earlier this year while on a trip with 2 boats out and the only thing catching was a gold Mepps for a whole week.  I know problably condition related but sold me.
Mepps, Trophy Trout series #3, as per this Brown who liked it. Liked it so much was hit 2 years in a row in the same spot same time of year.    It's my lucky spinner!
mepps over panther martin for me. But i use husky jerks and chartuese blue fox's more than the others for bigger brookies. Aglias with a stinger hook and worm as well.
both are awesome but for brookies i love double loon spinners
Mepps Black Fury with a half worm, catches anything that swims.

Panther Martin's in creeks & rivers, they seem to spin & swing easier.  Definitely has to be silver blade, yellow body, red dots.  They make others?  Mepps Aglia for lakes.  Black Fury when I'm feeling particulary contrary that day.
